intro: Coussarea roseocremea, commonly known as the pink cream coussarea, is a tropical shrub native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its striking, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters during the rainy season. The plant has glossy, ovate leaves that are arranged alternately along the stems. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for botanical gardens and collectors.
